item.title: A. add a quote by Werner Herzog
item.description: "Academia is the death of cinema. It is the very opposite of passion. Film is not the art of scholars, but of illiterates." -- Werner Herzog

item.title: A. add a quote by Sojourner Truth
item.description: "If women want rights more than they got, why don't they just take them, and not be talking about it." -- Sojourner Truth

item.title: A. add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Life's wildest moment---she kneels on the sidewalk. Everything else she does is lies, lies." -- Henry Miller

item.title: A. add a quote by Antonin Artaud
item.description: "If our life lacks a constant magic it is because we choose to observe our acts and lose ourselves in consideration of their imagined form and meaning, instead of being impelled by their force." -- Antonin Artaud

item.title: A. add a quote by Brian Eno
item.description: "Well, I am a dilettante. It's only in England that dilettantism is considered a bad thing. In other countries it's called interdisciplinary research." -- Brian Eno

item.title: A. add a quote by Le Thi Diem Thuy
item.description: "When I grow up I am going to be the gangster we are all looking for." -- Le Thi Diem Thuy

item.title: A. add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "if they put an iron circle around your neck I will bite it away" -- Toni Morrison

item.title: A. add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "Well, it's either kiss me or kill me, that's how I see it." -- Tom Waits

item.title: A. add a quote by Shirley Jackson
item.description: "Hill House, she thought, You're as hard to get into as heaven." -- Shirley Jackson

item.title: A. add a quote by Robert Walser
item.description: "That is all very senseless, but this senselessness has a pretty mouth, and it smiles." -- Robert Walser

item.title: A. add a quote by Avital Ronell
item.description: "To make things 'perfectly clear' is reactionary and stupefying. The real is not perfectly clear." -- Avital Ronell

item.title: A. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: A. add a quote by Werner Herzog
item.description: "What would an ocean be without a monster lurking in the dark? It would be like sleep without dreams." -- Werner Herzog

item.title: A. add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Nature is a haunted house--but Art--is a house that tries to be haunted." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: A. add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "Tis strange,-but true; for truth is always strange; Stranger than fiction: if it could be told, How much would novels gain by the exchange! How differently the world would men behold!" -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: A. add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Nobody owns life, but anyone who can pick up a frying pan owns death." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: A. add a quote by T.E. Lawrence
item.description: "All men dream: but not equally. Those who dream by night in the dusty recesses of their minds wake up in the day to find it was vanity, but the dreamers of the day are dangerous men, for they may act their dreams with open eyes, to make it possible." -- T.E. Lawrence

item.title: A. add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "[Horror fiction] shows us that the control we believe we have is purely illusory, and that every moment we teeter on chaos and oblivion." -- Clive Barker

item.title: A. add a quote by Robert Walser
item.description: "To the question: How do the authors of sketches, stories and novels get along in life, the following answer can or must be given: They are stragglers and they are down at heel." -- Robert Walser

item.title: A. add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "As to my mouth, of all my features, I wish I could possess my mouth again, just as it had been before the fire. I had my mother’s lips, generous below and above; and what kissing I had practiced, mainly on my hand or on a lonely pig, had convinced me that my lips would be the source of my good fortune. I would kiss with them, and lie with them, I would make victims and willing slaves of anyone my eyes desired, simply by talking a little, and following the talk with kisses, and the kisses with demands. And they’d melt into compliance, everyone of them, happy to perform the most demeaning acts as long as I was there to reward them with a long, tongue-tied kiss when they were done. But the fire didn’t spare my lips; it took them too, erasing them utterly." -- Clive Barker

item.title: A. add a quote by Johnny Cash
item.description: "My arms are too short to box with God." -- Johnny Cash

item.title: A. add a quote by Kathy Acker
item.description: "Murder is a dream because lack is the center of both." -- Kathy Acker

item.title: A. add a quote by Jonathan Goldstein
item.description: "In his day, liking someone like David Bowie would have been the domain of degenerate officers in black and white movies about nazis." -- Jonathan Goldstein

item.title: A. add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "I stood in the middle of the room flipping and Pusher was plucking at the guitar, just one string, and I went up to him and said, 'Man don't pluck those dirty notes at ME,' and like he just got up without a word and left. [Mardou]" -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: A. add a quote by T. E. Lawrence
item.description: "If I could talk it like Dahoum, you would never be tired of listening to me." -- T. E. Lawrence

item.title: A. add a quote by Heather O'Neill
item.description: "His adolescents are displaced aristocrats who have lost their kingdom and wealth, which was childhood. [On J.D. Salinger]" -- Heather O'Neill

item.title: A. add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Don't be bitter. Remember Lot's wife when they kill me, and they surely will. You have to use all of your energy to do what it is you have to do. [To his wife Betty Shabazz]" -- Malcolm X

item.title: A. add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "So early in my life, I had learned that if you want something, you had better make some noise." -- Malcolm X

item.title: A. add a quote by Alice Sebold
item.description: "You save yourself or you remain unsaved." -- Alice Sebold

item.title: A. add a quote by Mike Tyson
item.description: "Everybody has a plan until they get punched in the face." -- Mike Tyson
